description: [Status: stable] [Name: percent-format-invalid-format] [Message: %-format string has invalid format string: {message}] What it does Checks for invalid printf-style format strings. Why is this bad? Conversion specifiers are required for printf-style format strings. These specifiers must contain a % character followed by a conversion type. Example "Hello, %" % "world" Use instead: "Hello, %s" % "world"
